module.name: scrtdd
module.description: Double-Difference location module for real-time and event catalogs.

parameter.name: automaticOrigins
parameter.description: Allow relocation of automatic origins

parameter.name: manualOrigins
parameter.description: Allow relocation of manual origins

parameter.name: onlyPreferredOrigins
parameter.description: Relocate only preferred origins. When disabled scrtdd listens to LOCATION group and tries to relocate any origin. When enabled scrtdd listens to EVENT group and tries to relocate the preferred origin of an event.

parameter.name: activeProfiles
parameter.description: Defines a list of active profiles for single-event processing.

parameter.name: delayTime
parameter.description: Specifies a delay time in seconds after an origin is created/updated to trigger the single-event relocation.

parameter.name: profileTimeAlive
parameter.description: Defines how long the profile data should be kept in memory (in seconds). This is useful to release memory (catalog waveform data) after a period of inactivity. A negative value force the profiles to stay always in memory.

parameter.name: cacheWaveforms
parameter.description: Save reference catalog waveforms to local disk after they have been loaded the first time. This avoids re-reading them from the configured recordStream.

parameter.name: cacheDirectory
parameter.description: Defines the directory used for storing waveform cache.

parameter.name: cachedWaveformLength
parameter.description: The waveform length (centered around pick time) to be used for the disk cache. Although the required waveform length is inferred from the cross-correlation settings, this option allows for a longer disk cached trace that becomes useful in case the cross-correlation settings are changed in the future.

group.name: profile
group.description: Each profile is a configuration set with an optional region. The region is used only in real-time processing to select a profile for an origin. If an origin falls in multiple profile regions, the profile defined first in 'activeProfile' option will be used. This allows for hierarchical regions, where special regions are defined first and a broader region is defined last. A profile is enabled in real-time processing only when added to 'activeProfile' option.

parameter.name: regionType
parameter.description: Type of region: RECTANGULAR or CIRCULAR.

parameter.name: region
parameter.description: Optional. If regionType is RECTANGULAR then 4 comma separated values are expected: min_lat, min_lon, max_lat, max_lon. If regionType is CIRCULAR then 3 comma separated values are expected: lat, lon, radius in km. If left empty it represents a limitless region.

parameter.name: methodID
parameter.description: This is the methodID label that is stored in the created origin.

parameter.name: tableType
parameter.description: Travel time table format type (e.g. LOCSAT, libtau, homogeneous).

parameter.name: tableModel
parameter.description: The model to be used. The format depends on tableType.

parameter.name: PSTableOnly
parameter.description: If enabled, the arrival travel time information are fetched using 'P' and 'S' tables only and the user selected specific phase type is not considered (e.g. Pg, Sg, PmP, SmS, P1, S1, etc).

parameter.name: P-Phases
parameter.description: Defines a list of accepted P phases. Phases not in the list will be ignored.

parameter.name: S-Phases
parameter.description: Defines a list of accepted S phases. Phases not in the list will be ignored.

parameter.name: pickUncertaintyClasses
parameter.description: Define the pick time uncertainty classes from which the pick weight is computed. This parameter defines a list of uncertainty time intervals: the interval in which a pick time uncertainty falls defines the pick class e.g. a pick with uncertainty of 0.150 falls in the 4th interval and the pick class is then 4. if pick uncertainties are absent, the lowest class will be used. The pick weight is computed as: 1 / 2^(class-1)

group.name: catalog
group.description: Define the reference catalog for single-event mode.

parameter.name: eventFile
parameter.description: Path to event file to be used for this profile. If this file contains just one column called "origin", then each line must be an existing origin id and neither phase.csv nor station.csv files are required. Alternatively the extended format requires all of event.csv, phase.csv and station.csv files to be provided

parameter.name: phaFile
parameter.description: Path to catalog picks file to be used for this profile

parameter.name: stationFile
parameter.description: Path to the stations file to be used for this profile

group.name: doubleDifferenceSystem
group.description: These options control the clustering phase, which is responsible to selects the event pairs and their phases to be used in the double-difference equation system.

group.name: eventFiltering
group.description: Exclude poorly connected events from the DD system: not enough phases and/or neighbours

parameter.name: minNumPhases
parameter.description: Minimum number of phases at common stations required by event pairs. Event pairs not satisfying this condition will not be used.

parameter.name: minNumNeighbours
parameter.description: Minimum number of neighbours required by an event. Events not satisfying this condition will not be used.

group.name: phaseFiltering
group.description: Exclude not optimal phases from the DD system.

parameter.name: minStationToEventPairDistRatio
parameter.description: Minimum ratio between event-station to inter-event distance allowed. Phases belonging to stations not satisfying this condition will not be used.

parameter.name: minStationDistance
parameter.description: Minimum distance (km) between event and station required for a phase to be used. Phases belonging to stations not satisfying this condition will not be used.

parameter.name: maxStationDistance
parameter.description: Max distance (km) between event and station allowed for a phase to be used. Phases belonging to stations not satisfying this condition will not be used. A value of 0 or less disables this limit.

group.name: eventPairSelection
group.description: Control how neighbouring events are selected. In the simpliest form 'numEllipsoids' is set to 0 and the neighbours are selected on the nearest neighbour basis within a search distance of 'maxNeighbourDistance'. When 'numEllipsoids' is not 0, the ellipsoid selection algorithm is used. From Waldhauser 2009: "to assure a spatially homogeneous subsampling, reference events are selected within each of five concentric, vertically elongated ellipsoidal layers of increasing thickness. The dimension of the ellipsoid is based on the assumed error in the routine locations and the maximum interevent distance over which model errors can still be effectively minimized. The layers are twice as thick at the poles than they are at the equator to accommodate the generally larger error in the depth of the routine location of a new event. Each layer is split up into its eight quadrants (or cells), and the neighboring events are selected from each of the 40 cells.". Thus the neighbours are selected for each ellipsoid/quadrant combination in a round robin fashion until 'maxNumNeighbours' is reached.

parameter.name: maxNumNeighbours
parameter.description: Maximum number of neighbors per event. A value of 0 disables this limit

parameter.name: maxNeighbourDistance
parameter.description: Maximum distance allowed between an event and its neighbouring events. if numEllipsoids is greater than 0, then this value is the horizontal axes length (km) of the outermost boundary. Each inner concentric layer axis will be half of the previous one. The vertical axis is twice as long as the horizontal ones.

parameter.name: numEllipsoids
parameter.description: If set to 0 the nearest neighbour event selection is used. Otherwise this is the number of concentric ellipsoidal layers to be used in the neighboring event selection.

parameter.name: maxNumNeighbours
parameter.description: Maximum number of neighbors per event. A value of 0 or less disables this limit

parameter.name: maxNeighbourDistance
parameter.description: Maximum distance allowed between an event and its neighbouring events. if numEllipsoids is greater than 0, then this value is the horizontal axes length (km) of the outermost boundary. Each inner concentric layer axis will be half of the previous one. The vertical axis is twice as long as the horizontal ones.

parameter.name: numEllipsoids
parameter.description: If set to 0 the nearest neighbour event selection is used. Otherwise this is the number of concentric ellipsoidal layers to be used in the neighboring event selection.

group.name: crossCorrelation
group.description: Cross-correlation is used to improve the differential times used in the double-difference system

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the waveform cross-correlation.

parameter.name: minStationDistance
parameter.description: Minimum allowed distance between event and station. Phases belonging to closer stations will not be used in cross-correlation.

parameter.name: maxStationDistance
parameter.description: Maximum allowed distance between event and station. Phases belonging to further stations will not be used in cross-correlation. Setting it to -1 removes the limits.

parameter.name: maxInterEventDistance
parameter.description: Maximum allowed distance (km) between events for a cross-correlation to happen. Phases of event pairs whose inter-event distance if further than this value will not be used in cross-correlation. Setting it to -1 removes the limits.

parameter.name: minCCCoef
parameter.description: Min cross-correlation coefficient accepted to use a differential travel time.

parameter.name: winStart
parameter.description: Start of data window to cross-correlate with respect to pick time (+/- secs).

parameter.name: winEnd
parameter.description: End of data window to cross-correlate with respect to pick time (+/- secs).

parameter.name: winScaling
parameter.description: Window scaling coefficient. Window Length = (winEnd-winStart) + TravelTime * winScaling.

parameter.name: maxDelay
parameter.description: Maximum data windows lag accepted (secs).

parameter.name: components
parameter.description: Priority list of components to be used in the cross-correlation (e.g. Z, N, E, 1, 2, 3). If the component exists for both the phases to be cross-correlated then it is used, otherwise the next component in the list is tried. Special values are 'H', which computes the L2 norm of the 2 horizontal components and 'T' (and 'R'), which computes the transversal (and radial) component with respect with the event location to which the phase belongs to. If the value is left empty, the component where the phases were picked is used (if identical).

parameter.name: minCCCoef
parameter.description: Min cross-correlation coefficient accepted to use a differential travel time.

parameter.name: winStart
parameter.description: Start of data window to cross-correlate with respect to pick time (+/- secs).

parameter.name: winEnd
parameter.description: End of data window to cross-correlate with respect to pick time (+/- secs).

parameter.name: winScaling
parameter.description: Window scaling coefficient. Window Length = (winEnd-winStart) + TravelTime * winScaling.

parameter.name: maxDelay
parameter.description: Maximum data windows lag accepted (secs).

parameter.name: components
parameter.description: Priority list of components to be used in the cross-correlation (e.g. Z, N, E, 1, 2, 3). If the component exists for both the phases to be cross-correlated then it is used, otherwise the next component in the list is tried. Special values are 'H', which computes the L2 norm of the 2 horizontal components and 'T' (and 'R'), which computes the transversal (and radial) component with respect with the event location to which the phase belongs to. If the value is left empty, the component where the phases were picked is used (if identical).

group.name: waveformFiltering
group.description: Filter waveforms before performing the cross-correlation

parameter.name: filterString
parameter.description: SeisComP string based filter definition e.g."ITAPER(1)>>BW_HLP(2,1,20)". Set to "" to disable filtering.

parameter.name: margin
parameter.description: Extra seconds to add to the waveform ends before applying the filter. Useful to initialize the filter and to discard potential filter artifacts at the beginning and end of trace

parameter.name: resampling
parameter.description: Resample all traces at this samplig interval (hz) Set it to 0 disable resampling.

group.name: solver
group.description: These options control the double-difference system solver. The solution to the double-difference system is found through an iterative process: a double-difference system is built from the origin initial locations and solved. Then the hypocenters are updated based on these initial solutions and a new system is built and solved again multiple times until 'algoIterations' iterations is reached.

parameter.name: solverType
parameter.description: Solver algorithm to use: either LSMR or LSQR

parameter.name: algoIterations
parameter.description: Number of iterations for the solver to perform.

parameter.name: downWeightingByResidual
parameter.description: At each iteration the solver down-weighs the double-difference equations accordingly to their residuals. This option indicates the standard deviation of the residuals beyond which an equation weight becomes 0. A value of 0 disables downweighting. One or two values can be given; when two values are given the first value is used in the first iteration, the second value in the last iteration and the iterations in between use interpolated values.

parameter.name: dampingFactor
parameter.description: Setting a value different than 0 enables the solver to use a damped (regularized) least squares system. A too high value prevents the solver from changing the events locations, while a too low value allows the event cluster(s) to shift away from their absolute location (unless `absoluteLocationConstraint` is used). One or two values can be given; when two values are given the first value is used in the first iteration, the second value in the last iteration and the iterations in between use interpolated values.

parameter.name: absoluteLocationConstraint
parameter.description: When a value greater than 0 is used, the double-difference system is modified to solve for both absolute and relative locations. Additional equations are added, which constrain the absolute travel time residuals. This option selects the weight to be given to these equations. One or two values can be given; when two values are given the first value is used in the first iteration, the second value in the last iteration and the iterations in between use interpolated values.

parameter.name: xcorrWeightScaler
parameter.description: Weight scaling of the equations that use cross-correlation differential times with respect to equations that use differential pick times only.

parameter.name: usePickUncertainties
parameter.description: Whether to use pick time uncertainty to weigh each pick accordingly to 'pickUncertaintyClasses'. If enabled, each double-difference equation weight will be the average of its pick weights.
